page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: {Matlock}occupies a central position in the county of{Derbyshire.}The town is built mainly on the side of the valley of the River Derwent.The river has eroded a wide, flat-bottomed valleyin the shaley rock and this is overlooked by a steep, gritstone escarpment to the East.To the West of the river, the limestone of the southern tip of the Pennines is exposed. Most of the residential buildings are built on the steep eastern escarpment above the flood level of the river.The shops and business premises, however, cluster around the bridge. Four main roads converge on the bridge.
